elements.text:
A friend tells a funny joke and you start to laugh really hard. While you're laughing, you feel an uncomfortable tightness in your chest that you've never felt before. 

Here are some behaviors that someone might do at that moment or in the future:

text: I want to leave, but remind myself that this tightness could be happening for many reasons, even just excitement about being with my friend.
I tell myself that this tight feeling isn't serious.
I tell my friend that's the best joke I've ever heard.
I take a nice slow breath and keep enjoying my time with friends.
I immediately start to look up online what this feeling means.
